Side Effects: This medicine made me totally wiped out and completely sick.Anyone could lose weight on this stuff you never eat and when you do you get so sick.Bad_bad stomach cramps and bubbles in your belly.Then on day three and four I got the burps with a foul smell and taste.It was miserable I kept thinking if I just stay on it I'll get used to it.This drug is so not worth it.STAY AWAY FROM IT!

Took  for two days and had an allergic reaction . All over body itching and bad rash on  arms. Had to take an antihistamine cocktail for a week. Stopped that and rash has come back. Can't find anywhere that states how long the victoza stays in your system.  Also having blurred vision with second go around of rash.
The only side effect I've had is waking up with really bad acid reflux. And the thing is I already take two medications for this. Omeprazole and ranitidine. But they're not even helping with this.
Comments: I have not experienced any weight lost yet... but then again. I have been on a .6 milligram for 2 weeks and I just started my 1.2 dose yesterday. Not sure if this is going to happen with this. I'm really hoping it will.

Side Effects: No side effects but I did not lose any weight and blood sugar is still high

At first nausea. Then diarrhea. After diarrhea I couldn't have a bowel movement for a week. I was extremely uncomfortable. Doctor put me on stool softeners but nothing worked. Then I developed heart palpitations that were severe. Doctors DC'D the insulin. But_ I'm still experiencing heart palpitations. Hoping my heart beat returns back to normal. I read that this can happen and that death can happen as a result. I'm off of this  drug.
Comments: By far_ too dangerous.

Side Effects: Insomnia. Made deÃÅpression worse. No appetite. Lethargic. Shaky. General feeling of not feeling good.
Comments: Not sure why this drug is allowed. Kickbacks i am guessing.

Side Effects: Terrible drug!  Flu-like symptoms continuously...never have been this sick....the only reason you lose weight is because you're sick all the time....the creators of Victoza need to be made to take it themselves....should not be on the market!

I have had migraines_ nausea_ throat ache_ horrible body aches_ arms_ legs_ back_ neck_ loss of energy and of strength_ I have to walk slowly_ my arms hurt when I carry even a glass of water.  I started with 0.6 for 1 month and was fine_ then to 1.2 for 3 weeks and I started to feel the symptoms that I described above_ then I went to 1.8mg and was there for two days.  Now that my symptoms have increased my doctor stopped the medicine completely.  I feel awful.
Comments: On the other hand I lost 8lbs in 2 months.  Loss of appetite

Side Effects: sulphur burps_ gas_ bloating_ nausea
Comments: Victoza really lower my blood sugar_ but the side effects are just too much to deal with_ weaning off.

Side Effects: Very horrible extreme nausea vomiting headache sore throat sinus problems diarrhea chills
Comments: The first time I took it at the 1.2 mg level I missed 3 days of work and had all the side effects listed above. I thought I had contracted a virus. I stopped taking it. I tried a month later at the .6 mg level and same symptoms maybe not as bad but still too bad to continue. Missing work today due to diarrhea and cold symptoms. I am done with this drug feels like poison to my body

Side Effects: Only side effects were extreme nausea if I did not eat soon enough. Lost 50 pounds and was not eating like a diabetic should. I decided to quit taking because I am tired most of the time_ cannot sleep and seems to be aggravating my depression. I also have rheumatoid arthritis and am worried that the drug is increasing the general malaise you feel with RA. This drug is not a good companion to the illnesses that I have struggled with for a long time
Comments: I was worried about pancreatic or thyroid cancer from the beginning but my doctor said the chances were Slim as opposed to my hi A1C scores. I knew that I should be following a strict diet_ but once I was on it I lost weight so fast that I kept taking it. Now after two years_ I have decided the risk is not worth it. I have never been the type to be nauseated in my entire life and can get extremely violent Leon nauseated now so this is a very strong drug. Who knows what else it could be doing to my body. I am going to follow a more nutritious diet and see what happens.

Side Effects: Nausea_vomiting_diarrhoea
Comments: I got prescribed victoza to assist with suppressing my appetite (which is the biggest issue for me) and lowering my glucose levels (borderline high). What can I say I was amazed at how little I ate and how I did not crave any sweets or had any itches to snack. It was almost as though I got sleeve surgery done. However and unfortunately it was a horrible 72 hours and I have thrown in the towel already. Wave of sickness from morning to night. Woke up vomiting and had 4 sessions of diarrhoea. It was nothing short of just plain ugly. The fear of the unknown with how much longer I had to put up with it got the better of me and I have decided to give it up. It actually gave me more motivation to work on my portion control by myself so I don't have to put up with it. I now eat reduced sized meals and have overall lowered my carbohydrate intake. I'm 2 weeks into doing this now. I respect those who need it who have diabetes etc and all the best to them. This was just not for me I couldn't bare mentally or maintain these symptoms with my lifestyle. So I have started a tough journey to self discipline with food and increasing my exercise.

Side Effects: Vomitting severe nausea...diahrea...have good months and bad months also get horrible egg taste  and constant burping
Comments: It has bad side effects and althought it bought diabetes under xontrol im thinking of coming off it

Reason: to lower my blood sugar and hemoglo
Side Effects: Diarrhea_nausea_dizzy_vomiting_tired all the time.
Comments: Don't recommend this if your real sensitive to Medicine

Side Effects: Nausea_ diarrea_ bloated and distended stomach and gurgling intestines_ swollen neck_ dizziness_ foggy-headed very ill in the mornings - missed work_ blurred vision_ depressive episodes_ fatigue and headaches.
Comments: For sure it dropped my resting sugars - all the way to 80 from 110-130 when controlled only by Metformin- but the side effects are so terrible it's hard to describe.  My doctor gave me samples but has had no information for me when I've asked about the side effects or how to deal with severe nausea.  I don't think we know enough about this drug and I am taking myself off of it before this gets worse.

Side Effects: I learned very quickly_ I had to adjust to the med. First_ take it at night. Secondly_ you will have varying degrees of gastrointestinal discomfort. Mine largely passed_ as I moved from .6 to 1.2 MG_ BUT you have to consume significant amounts of water (very light green and white tea helps_ because of the warmth)_ and while it helps with over eating_ you have to do your part too_ by listening to your body tell you that you need less_ and DIFFERENT food. High fiber and pro-biotic nutrients (live culture yogurt_ kefir_ etc.)_ solid ... warm breakfast_ good protein and healthy fats for lunch_ and lite dinners. Not only does this help reduce the discomfort_ also with the weight loss I feel "up" so long as I don't eat heavy foods. But the real life saver was cannabis (legal in Oregon). Pretty much stopped the nausea in its tracks_ in very small amounts before bed. My insulin use (Lantus and Humalog) have been reduced by more than half so far_ and I am seeing fasting sugars of 79-1

pancreatitis_ severe back and stomach pain_ shoulder pain_ and my blood sugar has been above 250 since I stopped taking it. The severe back and stomach pain is still with me after three weeks of stopping this medication. My whole body seems to be aching as well. This medication has created a horrific experience for me. I cannot stress enough that this product seems to have long lasting adverse affects.
Comments: The doctors at the emergency room that I want to don't seem to be well-informed about the adverse affects that a person can get from taking Victoza. There was a consensus that after stopping this medication that I would no longer be in any kind of pain_ this could be further from the truth. There needs to be a comprehensive study of The long-term effects after taking this medication. I feel that even though I read the possible side affects pamphlet that accompanied it_ the wording was not strong enough; the prescribing physician also did not adequately explain the possible ramifications of using this medication. Perhaps_ and I'm guessing here_ that the pharmaceutical representative was giving them too many perks; like say vacations maybe? I really don't know_ but this drug needs to be re-evaluated for sure.

Side Effects: nausea and headaches for the first 2 weeks_ then that's it.
Comments: On victoza for 16 mo.  Prior to Victoza_ I suffered severe fatigue_ high blood pressure_ hypo thyroid_ depression_ epstein bar and other symp.  Prior to endo_ went to 5 diff. drs and they all medicated me w/out results.  After Victoza_ nausea and headaches for about 2 weeks_ then I felt like a new human being.  Energy_ no depression_ lost 30 pounds.  Endo & I decided to slowly come off the meds.  After 1.5 weeks_ began to feel fatigue and began to gain weight.  TERRIFIED... that I would go back to my old self again and of all the reports of pancreatitis_ thyroid n pancreas cancer.  If I go back on_ am I taking a risk?  Scared...

Side Effects: Pancreatic rejection resulting in non-stop vomiting_ diarrhea_ migraine_ dizziness_ and total loss of energy
Comments: Get ready for a shot to your PANCREAS....never again....until somebody dies to take it off the market

Reason: Blood sugar control and weight loss
Side Effects: The first time I tried it I got very sick one day.  I was taking metformin 1000mg and I think my sugar dropped very low.  It was a horrible panic cold sick feeling.  Took a few days to recover.  I'm not sure what happened exactly but it was terrible. It felt like I was going to die all day and til 3am.  The NP had started me on 1.8 instead of 0.6mg as the directions recommend. We restarted at 0.6mg a few days and gradually increase yo 1.8 mg.  It helps the cravings a lot. Th e first time it almost shut my appetite off completely toward the end of the week.
Sweating_ dizziness and heart .
Severe uncontrollable diareaha and horrible sour stomach.
Comments: I am very happy about losing 13lbs in the 1st month. I pray the side effects will go away!

Side Effects: Initially I had no side effects and lost 45 pounds taking Victoza along with Glumetza (a timed released version if Metformin) and felt great and my 9.7 AIC was reduced to 5.1 but that was short lived when in December I was rushed to the ER and hospitalized for 5 days with Acute Pancreatitis and my Lipese level was 9000....yes 9000 and was taken almost twice a day for 5 days and only lowered to 2000 and when I was admitted it was only 799.  I was discharged with a lipase level higher than when I was admitted but I was clinically feel better and no pain.  U had really bad headaches from nit taking the Victoza for a few days. I still am having issues with my pancreas.  I developed a large cyst in my ankle which presses in an a nerve and is very painful and a large mass on one of my breasts that was bleeding and now secreating a yellow fluid that I am having surgically removed. I have not taken the Victoza since my admission to the hospital in December.

Reason: Blood sugar control and weight loss
Side Effects: Diarrhea_ insomnia_ severe depression toward end of one week.  Racing heart_ anxiety to almost panic.  General feeling of malaise and don't feel good.  New onset of upper back pain.
Comments: It seriously controls appetite and sweet cravings like nothing had before.  I must stop taking it today.  I feel like I'm losing my mind right now.  Terrible feeling that has gradually increased.

Side Effects: Horrendous nightmares ALL night_ anxiety..not my normal thru the roof_ constipation_ slept like 16 hours not my normal_ migraines everyday_ nausea_ no appetite.
Comments: I don't like it.

Side Effects: Nausea vomiting diarrhea uncontrollable no appetite dizziness blurred vision tiredness want to stay in bed
Comments: Notice when I up the dose to 1.8 that's when the side effects happened I'm thinking about quitting this medication is not worth the pain and suffering.

Side Effects: Nausea vomiting diarrhea uncontrollable no appetite dizziness blurred vision tiredness want to stay in bed
Comments: Notice when I up the dose to 1.8 that's when the side effects happened I'm thinking about quitting this medication is not the pain and suffering.

Side Effects: Constpation is my only side effect.
Comments: My A1C has drop from 9.6 to 7.3 in the three months I have been on Victoza. The constipation side effect is worth it to me_ as long as my A1C countinues to progress in the the right direction. I also take 50 units of Lantus in the morning and 50 units at night now. I use to take 80 units twice a day. I have now changed my diet to more fresh fruits and vegetables and leaner meat (chicken breast and lean ground turkey). Have seen a little bit of a change in my constipation since I changed my diet. Also have increased my water intake.

Side Effects: Had typical side effects of nausea and eggy burps for 1-2 weeks and they went away. Only experience nausea now if I overeat especially if high in carbs.
Comments: It has given me great blood sugar control and my A1c numbers have been excellent since starting. It has been a wonder drug for me.

Side Effects: Diarrhea_ nausea_ vomiting up food & bile_ lost appetite. Went to Gastroenterologist he said to stop Victoza. Dr said some people cant tolerate it. Once I stopped taking I got better.
Comments: I lost 20 lbs because I couldn't eat very much and what I did eat I threw up.

Side Effects: Severe nausea_ fatigue_ blurred vision_ egg burps_ constipation
Comments: Lost weight but mainly because I was so sick all the time.  It was incredibly hard to function throughout the day.  Dr kept telling me I'd get used to it.  Didn't.  Tried Zofran for the nausea but that made the constipation 1000 times worse and barely helped the nausea.

Side Effects: Absolute misery. Malaise_ headache_ nausea_ NO energy_ sick and just absolute misery. I was having such great blood sugar control I wanted it to get better. I heard if you can get through a month the symptoms will go away. I was 6 weeks at 1.2 mg and 2 weeks at 0.6 to start. Was sick the entire time.
Comments: I fought through severe misery for 8 weeks and have even tried it a 2nd time. I went up 1 click of the dial at a time to try to slowly get my body use to it. Spent 2 more months of misery with it. Will not do it again!!!

Side Effects: None -- expect much better morning BG reading.  And not hungry.
Comments: The difference in my morning blood sugars was 140 down to 90 in 2 days.  I believe I am one of those this may work for.

Side Effects: A pregnant lady belly_ full of gaz_ strange voices coming out of it_ terrible bloating_ severe constipation_ severe nausea_ severe indigestion_ stomach increased acidity_ difficulty of eating any kind of raw vegetables. Muscles weakness and unstable mood and irritability.
Comments: I lost 4 kgs in one month _ but it was a hell to live with it. I'd rather prefer to take the extra kilos back than to live with this nightmare experience

Side Effects: Severe constipation_ slight nausea
Comments: Too bad I cant use Victoza. It worked very well to get my blood sugars down and I lost almost 10 of the 25 I needed to lose_ however the constipation was so bad my endocrinologist told me to stop. Was going toilet only once a week and very hard_ even w stool soteners_ laxatives plenty of h2o. Only milk of magnesia really worked . I think because I am already prone to constipation it wasn't good drug for me.

Side Effects: Started with migraines on days 1 and 2_ 3-7 was all but a blur_ I couldn't hold any food down_ it was coming back up almost as fast as I could eat. Between the stomach aches_ vomiting_ diarrhea and dizziness_ I was barely able to function! The last day of taking this_ I was so weak that I slept 17 hours of the 24 hour day
Comments: I need to lose a few pounds_ sure_ but there are far better and more safe ways to o that. I wouldn't wish the way I have felt and as sick as I got on anyone_ not even my worst possible enemy!!

Side Effects: None
Comments: I'm a retired RN_ I was on 200 u Novlin N  every day and 100 u Novolog. I was started on Victoza @ 1.8 for about 6 mo. When my son said his Dr increased him to 3.0 and his A1c came down to 5.5. So I very carefully started to titrate up and watching my blood sugars. I'm now at 2.8 and less than 10 units Novlin n at bedtime. I also got my D3 level up to 50. Today my A1c is 6.9 down from 8.9 and I feel like a human_ no depression or tired and sleeping all the time. I'm thrilled. 2 shots a day_ not 6 and all my blood work was within normal limits

Side Effects: Nausea and mild gastrointestinal effects. I already have IBS so the effects are negligible comparatively. Food when I actually feel like eating seems to taste too strongly so I don't eat much. No interest at all in sugary tastes. Only wish to drink water.
Comments: My morning blood sugars are around 85 which is a miracle. Even when I was pre-diabetic and when I was on insulin during pregnancy_ I never had fasting blood sugars this low.

Side Effects: severe intestinal cramping and pain_ severe flatulence_ diarrhea_ glands swelling_ aggravated Hashimotos thyroiditis_ caused A1C to INCREASE dramatically
Comments: Should be taken off the market

Side Effects: Sulfa eggs burps horrible stomach aches diarrhea. Stomach pains gas
Comments: But my sugar when I am testing it has been in 110 range which before was in the 300 and Ive lost about 30lbs in a month which I can deal with the nasty side effects. I haven't been hungry at all have to force myself to have a couple bites of food and I and not craving sweets as I did badly before. I and mm pleased with how it's helped me so far and I pray I can continue to take without any bad side effects

Side Effects: No side effects
Comments: Love it. I've lost 30lbs. Feel great. I changed my diet light exercise. More energy brought my A1C down

Side Effects: Blurred vision_ insomnia_ itchy
Comments: Loved that it reduced my appetite and I lost 5 lbs in the first week.  However I can not deal with the blurred vision.

Side Effects: Severe nausea. Vomiting. Shaking. Blurred eyesight. Migraine.
Comments: I would never take it again

Side Effects: Extreme nausea and vomiting_ although it sure cut down on my appetite. Exhaustion from being sick 24 hours a day.
Comments: I don't know how anyone can hold a job taking this medication if they experience the same side effects that I did. I would just spontaneously throw up in my office at work. Then I would be exhausted.

Side Effects: Side effects stated with in first 24hrs. By day 5 they were unbearable . Could barely function on day 5. But it really lowered blood sugar. Just could not take anymore.

After a while_ nausea subsides. Constipated at times and believed to be caused by this medication. Occasionally will have slight discomfort (not pain) in my right side which I will tell my doctor next visit. Works well for me.

I am very sleepy. I burp a lot. My body hurts in my joints. My nose runs and I have a slighy head pounding. Good thing is that I am not hungry. But not much energy  to exercise.  About 14 hours after I take the shot I start to feel better. I am on the lowest dose now... How can I even consider going  up on it next week?  How long will this last????
Comments: So very expensive. Do not know if I can continue with it.

Side Effects: Severe headache that would not go away_ sinus pain_ severe back and shoulder pain_ occasional abdominal pain_ bloating stomach_ foul burps and gas_ extreme fatigue_ brain fog_ depressed mood.
Comments: My blood sugar did go down and appetite decreased.  But side effects were so severe that I could not function in my daily life.  Felt terrible_ exhausted and disconnected from my life.  I'm also extremely concerned about the potential damage from this drug.  For me_ this drug is not worth the problems it caused me.

Side Effects: Having diarrhea and sometimes reflux. So far_ love the side effect of nonappetite.
Comments: As a healthcare professional I have done a lot of research about Victoza and how it works. Think it can help patients in many ways but obviously everyone is different and some may not tolerate this.

Side Effects: Nausea_ lathargic_ diaherra
Comments: Not sure how much longer I can continue.  I had hoped I could lose some weight by taking it and get off diabetic med all together.  I feel bloated_  stomach unsettled.  Haven't been far from the bathroom since I started taking it.

Side Effects: I had horrible continuous nausea with some vomiting. Almost continual diarrhea. Horrible metallic taste in mouth which is still lingering even after being off almost a month. Terrible indigestion and sour stomach. The sour stomach is also lingering. I couldn't eat correctly. I ended up eating soft carbs because my stomach was so sour. I couldn't drink water so I was getting dehydrated. My sugars were great but I wasnt losing weight. I finally decided I'd had enough and stopped it.

Severe nausea_ vomiting_ no appetite_ constipation 3+ days_ lethargic_. Did not use 4th dose due to side-effects and woke up with half my tongue swollen to the roof of my mouth. Could only drink water. Clammy_ sweaty_ then freezing.
Comments: I do not think the side effects are worth any benefit I may get. Waiting to call doctor this am.

Side Effects: Within 3 weeks I dropped 25lbs. I had to go to hospital in April which I weighed 255lbs. A couple days after I weighed 260lb. I was recently at Dr on june23 and weighed 261.8. So looks like the usual with my body_ it adapts to medicine quickly then doesnt work!Ive always been that way.
Comments: Now Im starting to have really bad eggy burps and flatulence!! Ugh

Side Effects: Victoza worked great in lowering my blood sugar and A1c. I did have gastrointestinal side effects but they were manageable.
I have had nausea_ stomach bloating_ severe diarrhea accompanied with a rotten egg burp.
Comments: I have been off VICTOZA for four weeks now and I am having these same issues every other day. Sometimes it may give me a three day break but so far it has been persistent

Reason: To help with my type two diabetes
Side Effects: Very sick
Comments: since the sickness a disappeared I can not seem to lose any more weight

Side Effects: Got very ill.Dr took blood n my lipase and amylase numbers off the chart.He said i had acute pancreatitis.Iwill never take this drug again
Constipation_ nausea
Comments: I have used Victoza off and on for 3 years_ but finally consistently the last 6 months. I had to stop all the other times because I felt so horrible with nausea_ vomiting_ etc. This time I decided to take it at bedtime instead of morning_ and WOW big difference. I also started really low and only went up on the dose when I no longer had any side effects (other than constipation). I really can't take any more than five clicks beyond 1.2_ so that's what I do. I have lost more than 50#_ got off insulin_ and dropped my A1c from 8.4 to 5.1. I wouldn't attribute it all to Victoza_ because I have done the hard work_ but it makes me feel full and that is a big help in reducing intake and managing my blood sugars.

Side Effects: Constipation_ eggy burps_ nausea_ indigestion_ vomiting_ stomach cramps
Comments: In the first few weeks_ my appetite shut down completely and so did my cravings. Blood sugar dropped below 100 after about 2 weeks. The only side effect I experienced was constipation which was manageable. I attribute any weight loss to eating a proper caloric deficit_ which I was already doing before the medication.About 6 weeks in I started to experience the foul burps_ then within 3 days I was constantly nauseous_ vomiting_ cramping_ and still constipated. None of my food was getting processed.It's warm and fuzzy at first_ then it bites you hard. Never touching this stuff again_ praying I haven't done any lasting damage by taking it.

Side Effects: Headache in eyes and sinus. Loss of energy. Sweating cold sweating ckammy. No appetite. Feel just plain old horrible. How long till this is out of my system?
Comments: Will I ever feel good again?

Side Effects: I was eager to try this medication to help my blood sugar in use with my metformin and lantus but was more eager because I heard it helps you lose weight. Well I've lost 44lbs and I yes that's a wonderful thing but the horrible side effects that got me there is almost not worth it. Nausea_ vomiting_ no appetite_ and now I think extreme dizziness. Even had to go to er. Gotta talk to my endocrinologist asap BC I am getting to the point of almost passing out. I thought it may have been a different medication but it seems to be the victoza.
Comments: Victoza has multiple side effects which affect some people more than others. Just wanna let y'all who experience bad side effects that you are not alone and if its really bothersome then maybe you should really get on something different

Side Effects: I tried this along with metformin and with in 2 day was very sick. Had really bad burping_could not eat anything_ food did not digest at all and then started vomiting. I did stop it when I found out the same week I  needed my gallbladder out. Did retry this and I was even sicker With vomiting and diarrhea. I can not wait for this to get out of my system I don't know how long that will take.

Look at rating #6_  how this drug every got approved for human use If anybody ever looked I'm sure they would find a trail of money from pharmacy company to someone in fda looking at ratings here sadly people think this is a new diet weight loss drug guess if you can't restrict your diet and don't mind getting cancer this drug is for you
Comments: Come on people you have all the info online now please look before you leap pharmacy company's are spending millions to prompt you to try there new meds and making billions because you go to your doctor and ask for them! Do some research on avandia they had to pay a 3 billion dollar fine on that one because they didn't tell all they knew on it (they lied to get it approved) They should start there comericals with hey you might die from it but you'll look good in your coffin!

Side Effects: Ive read all the reviews on this site before I started the medication.So all the ones who give the bad reviews on VICTOZA_I SMH BECAUSE WHAT PEOPLE FAIL TO REALIZE IS THAT WHEN YOU DONT FOLLOW DIRECTIONS_ YOU WILL GET SYMPTOMS!!! Duh!! My diet has been the same except I began adding more Protein so what I eat was never a issue.I began Invokana which I love to help with A1c.That came down 7.4 from a 9.2 within 3 months. First week on Invokana I lost 6lbs but thats it! My weight went up. So Im 280 lbs now. All Im worried about is the fat.I started Victoza this past Thursday. I took it before I went to bed. About 20min later I became extremely sleepy and gasy. Friday I took it in morning_ same sleepiness/gasiness. Saturday upped my dose to 1.2 as per Dr.Only thing I have is the sleepiness thats it! I can tell Im losing _ just dont know the lbs yet. Ill weigh myself monthly.
Comments: I will see how i do and will update my progress periodically on my weightloss.

Side Effects: Dry mouth is the most predominant side effect... No headacheI LOVE NOT HAVING THE SUGAR CARBOHYDRATE CRAVINGS.When I increased the dose on day 7_ to .9I got diarrhea and nausea -- I'm going to try to stay below .9 as long as I can.From reading posts here it seems like the appetite and cravings return after a few weeks.
Comments: Taking the shot 15 minutes before a light well rounded breakfast with PROTEIN works best for me. Staying hydrated is a must-- seems to keep the nausea away.I'm also taking a fiber capsule daily and probiotic

Side Effects: Nausea but not too bad some stomach pain but not too. Every once in a while a headache but again not too bad.
Comments: I like the Vitoza because it's really helping to control my sugar however I wanted to take it to also help me lose weight I see that I'm losing inches but not a lot of pounds I really want to see the pounds come off

Side Effects: Tolerated Victoza at 1.2ML but 3 month A1C was not much better. Doctor raised dosage to 1.8 ML now have intestinal issues_ BGL not much better and feel weak and tired all the time.
Comments: For the money this drug does not improve my diabetic life to a point a feel its worth the side effects_ risks and improvement in A1C levels. I would not recommend to anyone who does not see big improvements within a few weeks and can tolerate the side effects.

Side Effects: First week I started taking it major headaches_ extreme nausea and extremely fatigued_ severe depression. Lost 15lbs in ONE WEEK! Had to stop taking it for two weeks (unfortunately gained the weight back) then tried it again. So this time I have loss of appetite and some nausea but nothing major but I've had a headache for a week and nothing will take it away. I have lost 12lbs in two weeks but I'm going to stop taking it again because of this headache I can't get rid of. I guess that's what I get for trying to lose weight the easy way :(
Comments: If you're taking this just to lose weight_ don't use this. The whole point of losing weight is to be and feel healthy and I just do not feel healthy anymore being on this medication.

Side Effects: Nausea for the first few days got better_ I loss 15 pounds in the first  two months_ no additional weight loss.
Comments: I stopped using Victoza . I went for a physical when I first started victoza  my physical was great . I shared with my dr that I was afraid to take victoza because of my family cancer hx. But I tried it for a few more months went back for a follow up visit to find out I now have thyroid nodules scheduled for biopsy will never take this drug again_ so angry at myself for going against my own judgement.

Side Effects: Loss of appetite_headache_burping_general unwell feeling_facial tenderness_cough_ pressure and bloating.
Comments: Very harsh on the body.  Lost 5 pounds.  You do not feel like eating at all but will stick it out a bit longer.  Had to lower dose to 1.2.  Is kind of toxic.

Side Effects: Mild diarrhea_ loss of food craving weight loss  mild injection  site pain
Comments: Seems  to be working  great for me so far. I feel  a lot better already.

Side Effects: Headaches_ Rt side pain_ no energy_ heart racing
Extreme abdominal pain front left and both kidneys hurt in my back. Two months of constant diarrhea.
Comments: It will make you lose weight and bring your numbers down. I dropped three pant sizes. I was happy the first 7 months. By the 7th month the pain set in. The 8th month I quit it. I'm speculating it has caused me pancreas and kidney damage. I'll find out in a couple weeks when I go to the doctors. If you have high cholesterol means you don't have the best pancreas to begin with. I've lost 84 lbs but at what cost?

Side Effects: Caused my husband 46_to have necrotizing pancreatitis with multiorgan failure.he almost died twice and is still very sick.he took victoza for over a year. Do not take this drug
Sickness and constipation. Loss of appetite
Comments: Takes a few days for body to settle down experienced all the symptoms mentioned by everyone. Lost weight  only mild side affects   On 1.8 now Started on 0.6   The increased dose has not changed my suger levels  as much as the earlier stages  this has been the most affective drug to control my sugar levels to date

Side Effects: The first two weeks of this drug are hard. Start at 0.6 for a week and then go up 1 click a week (no more) to avoid severe symptoms of nausea. Forget about eating. Side effects are much less if a person is active and eats less.
Comments: This is a very effective and very strong diabetic medicine which is over-prescribed and causes most of the bad side effects because of too high a dose. I was very cautious in adding it_ and through raising 1 click a week and checking bs 3 times a day and logging it found that 1.0mg 1x day brought my blood sugar under complete control with 2000mg of metformin which I intend to continue to take for insulin resistance. It allowed me to completely drop the 6mg of Glimeperide and while bringing my a1c from 7.8 to 6.2 after 15 years of being diabetic. I lost 23 lbs_ and changed my eating habits to conform with the Victoza and have kept it off. Those who claim they have put it back on do not realize the appetite loss goes away and you have to monitor your food intake closely as well as exercise. This is not a miracle drug which will work for you if you lay on the couch and eat. That will create the side effects.

Side Effects: I had Some nausea_ vomiting and upset stomach for about 3-4 days when first starting and each new level of dose.  I lost 24 pounds in the first month and my fasting numbers were between 94-115 on the 1st week. When I went up to the 1.2 fasting was 88-98 and I pretty much stay in those numbers all day. I tried moving up to 1.8 but the side effects mentioned above were just too much to handle with no real change in numbers that were already fantastic! I'm back at the 1.2_ I'm still losing about 1-2 lbs a week and am very pleased. I do however have the unpleasant injection site rash every now and then_ but it is much less frequently using the 8mm needles instead of the 6mm.
Intestinal cramps_ lower back pain_ major changes in toileting routine
Comments: I took this med for about 45 days. Doc wanted me to take for weight loss and glucose control. Never did make it to the 1.8 dosage. The intestinal cramps would wake me up at night_ not to mention the changes in my toileting routine were hard to tolerate. Lower back pain was excruciating. Have been off the med now for two to three weeks and side effects have stopped.

Reason: To manage my BS w/o so many needles
Side Effects: Nausea_ then uncontrollable vomiting. Lost 10 pounds in 3days.  Was never overweight. At almost 5'9" I weighed 160 lbsbefore Victoza. Loss of appetite. The little I did eat came back up in full force. Initially when I was first diagnosed with  diabetes type 2 I was taking Glipizide. In 2010 I was put on      insulin_ both Levemir and Humalog. There was no problem except I got tired of sticking myself with needles and wanted to return to oral medication. That when I was prescribed Victoza and 750 mg of Metformin. I have to take 0.6 for aweek_ 1.2 the 2nd week and 1.8 the 3rd week and thereafter.  I vomited a lot (and I mean a lot) but concludedthat maybe it was because of the levothyroxine and avorstatin medication.  When I stopped taking it_ the vomiting stopped and I felt better. With all the negative hypeabout the side effects_ I worry and don't really know if I will continue taking Victoza and Metformin. The best thing is that I only have to stick myself 2x daily no
Comments: I had been taking Levothyroxine for underactive thyroid andAvorstatin for my cholesterol a long time and don't think Victozashould be taken with these medications

Side Effects: I am having side effects like eggy burps nausea acid stomach diarrhea and bad sore throat. I am going to try to stick to it because it has brought my bs done and controlled.  Also insulin has made me gain 30 pounds which exasperate the problem.
stomach issues _ nausea and really sick stomach in the beginning.
Comments: I have lost 37 pounds in 3 months_ the side effects are almost gone and my body is adjusting well to this in combination with1000 mg Metformin daily also. I am taking 1.2 of the Victoza and my BS is great and my A1C has gone from 9.6 to 7.2  and I am thrilled. I just turned 60 and I feel like this is giving me a second chance. I knew that I was on the brinko of disaster and I am so thankful for this medicine. I know it is not going to be for everyone_ but don't give up so quickly. It has changed my life and I can't wait to loose another 20 lbs and stay healthy. Thank you researchers and doctors for this medicine. On the flip side I did not think I was going to be able to do this but as I said the sick stomach and fatique has subsided. Stick it out and let this work for you too.

Side Effects: felling fat round middle not hungrey bloated and  eyes were playing up

Reason: To lower glucose and to lose weight
Side Effects: Headaches_swelling of the stomach_bruising in injection area_ extreme fatique_very sensitive_
Comments: I did not like the way I was feeling so I stopped. Did not lose any weight. Before starting Victoza my glucose level was a little high but I don't have diabetes. Now that I stopped (2weeks) my glucose levels are staying way too high. My stomach is feeling a lot better but now I am so worried about my glucose levels. :(

Side Effects: When you first start there is some nausea.  I did vomit a few times_ but I guess that probably depends on your tolerance for nausea.   That is the only bad effects I have.
Comments: This drug has been wonderful.  I started taking it because even on Metformin my A1c was 9.2_ fastings in the high 200s.  It was horrible_ bad foot neuropathy etc.  There is some nausea when you first start taking this and I had it fairly bad for the first month probably_ but there are things I learned to decrease it.  Smaller meals and I take the shot later in the day like a few hours after lunch.  The worst nausea occurred when I took it right after a meal...Don't do that!!!  It slows stomach emptying and if you take it right after your meal just sits there and causes issues.  I am over 350 pounds and in 3 months I've lost 35 pounds effortlessly. My A1c went from 9.2 to 6.5 in the first three months. I have been huge my whole life.  I have always felt like I was missing something that tells me when to stop eating....Victoza does that for me.  Now I will have a meal and eating along as normal and something will just tell me its enough and I stop with no problem.  I very rarely finish my plate now.  I have a stop button now and I stay full longer.  I no longer eat anything after dinner...no interest in it at all.  I also do not crave carbs like I use to.  Yes the side effects can be bad at first_ but I can say with all honesty that now 4 months out and I do not have any side effects_ but maybe rarely.  If you are big and your sugars are out of wack the side effects are worth it.  Just get through the first 2-4 weeks and be smart_ don't stuff yourself especially at dinner.  Als

Side Effects: Severe stomach issues including upper and lower digestive track. Was able to keep food down on 1.2 dosage but as soon as dosage was raised to 1.8_ I was deathly sick. I will not be going back on it because I feel that it is poison to my body. Did loose 20 lbs in 6 weeks_ but it was because I was only eating about 1000 cal. a day. Had no desire to eat_ look at_ or cook food. Had no energy at all and felt more depressed. It did lower my blood sugars_ but as little as I was eating_ it's no wonder.
Comments: I also experienced headaches and bloating the whole time I was on Victoza_ even at the lowest dosage.

Reason: Lower blood sugar and lose weight
Side Effects: did have a bit f nausea and vomiting
Comments: Well sadly did not lose any weight on the drugI would like to know why

Side Effects: Love this.  Lost 20 pounds this month.  Works best if I inject it in a fat fold vs middle of my stomach. Mild side effects nothing major.  Went down to 1200 cals a day easily without hunger pangs.

Severe gingival irritation was the main reason I stopped. Constipation was annoying_ but not a deal-breaker. I noticed reduced efficacy of other medications_ specifically my Lexapro.  Reduced my appetite somewhat_ but my motivation to exercise was reduced as well_ so it was a wash.
Comments: I was impressed by how painless the injections were.  Disappointed that it didn't work for me.

Side Effects: severe diarrhea vomiting shortness of breath nausea dizziness
Dizzy_ Nausea_ stomach cramps and headaches
Comments: Couldn't keep food down_ felt weak flu symptoms. Felt okay until after 3 months of taking it. After 7 months I lost the weight and stopped taking the drug_ then the symptoms started up again. Went to the doctor because I couldn't keep any food down_ I was diagnosed with stage 3 Stomach cancer! No one in family has ever had cancer_ this med is POISON!

Side Effects: Nausea_ bloating_ diarrhea_ cramping_ fatigue
Comments: My upper and lower GI side effects started a few hours after my first dose and have only intensified. I am nauseated all the time_ and my stomach is tender and bloated.  I feel like I need to have a massive burp_ but the little ones I can produce don't give any relief.   I have now learned that this med slows emptying of the stomach_ so the symptoms make sense.  The thought of food makes me want to throw up; if you can't eat_ then of course you're going to lose weight... this just isn't the way I want to do it_ LOL.  I will not be continuing with Victoza_ and pray that it won't take long for these symptoms to fade away.

Side Effects: Tiredness_ heart palpitations_ bloatedness_ eggy burping_ stomach discomfort

Lots of abdominal pain_ thought it was my gall bladder and after lots of tests found out it is not. Now have started the very bad sour tasting belching_ diarrhea_ that will be followed by severe throwing up. Notice if I am stressed it gets worse. I can't stand the burping and the gas. Was going to have more tests ran until after reading all the comments on here. Plus I have no energy at all. I took it for awhile in the past and never had this kind of problem. But now it is getting intolerable.
Comments: I was loving it until I have been getting so sick. I thought I kept catching the stomach bug going around. I am going to lay off a few days and see what happens. I have noticed that if I eat raw veggies_ fruits and a small piece of chicken_ and very small helpings the symptoms go away. But it also makes my blood sugar drop as well. I have lost nearly 60 pounds on this and love that. But hate how I feel. I long to be back to me. Going to talk to my doctor about this.

Side Effects: I did well until four weeks ago and developed a very sore throat and bronchitis. I had taken it for two months with no problems . I took antibiotics  and it helped a little and then things got worse. I looked up side effects and says sore throat__ upper respiratory infection _ and bronchitis. My doc didn't think that the Victoza was the cause.. I insisted on going  off the Victoa and the symptoms disappeared in three days. I may try it again but not until feeling well again
sOME HEADACHES . MINOR NAUTIOSNESS
Comments: took a lot of water weight 9n the first 30 days thata was it.With Metformin it keeps blood sgars 100-167.Generally works well_Hope for more weight loss

Side Effects: The first six weeks I had pain in my stomach. Mainly a pressure feeling in my stomach and lots of burping. That has now all stopped_ and then I increased to 1.8_ but was so dizzy_ and sore throat. I dropped back to 1.2 and that solved the problem. The weight loss has been slow_ but better then not taking it. I will give this more time.
Nautious on occasion . Headaches
Comments: Lost weight first month but that was it. I use it with Metformin and blood sugars are in check

Side Effects: Initially started on o.6 mg_ then after 2 weeks went to 1.2 mg.  Also started on Metformin_ 2000 mg a day.  I was confined to home with diarrhea 3-4 times per day; however_ after consulting with my doctor_ it was the high dose of Metformin_ so went down to 1000 mg and the diarrhea cleared up.  I do however_ have terrible dry mouth at night; I think using the CPAP machine does not help.  I am going to go back down to 0.6 mg and see how I do on that.  The dry mouth is so bad my tongue is literally stuck to the top of my mouth_ and my lips stuck to my gums.  It's awful.   However_ on a positive note_ I've lost 25 pounds.
Headaches
Comments: Dropped 19 pounds in 27 days__ Headaches daily now .Great appetite supressant

Side Effects: I did fine at .6 mg and really had very little nausea and dropped 3 IBs the first week. Then it came time to increase to 1.2 mg a day. I burped constantly and had this pressure in my stomach most of the time. I switched and started taking it at night and that improved greatly. I however have developed insomnia with it. I have lost 12 IBS in a month_ but don't sleep well. I may try taking it in the morning again. My BS are much improved.
Slight headace first  two days starting

So far so good_ I stated at .06 and had no side effects accept a little numbness in hands and feet_ but it went away. I do have some burping_ but tolerable. I have lost 4 IBS in two weeks without trying. My BS is now normal once I went to 1.2 mg.
minor nausea 4 hours after shot for the first several weeks.  however_ this stopped over time.
Comments: this has worked very well for me; was 50 lb overweight at 5'1" and could no longer reduce by regular methods. combined with strict dietary changes (low carb_ no fruit/ added sugar/starches) and exercise_ I lost 45 lb in less than 5 months. regained energy_ prob due to weight loss and mild hormone therapy. No nausea_ never had vomiting or diarrhea.  I will be transitioning off victoza (ramping down dosage now) and dr. expects I will be fine_ perhaps may need metformin in future_ but will see how it goes.  will keep dietary changes and exercise.

Side Effects: At 0.6 I did not experience any noticeable problems. Lost a few pound. Was increased to 1.8 and taken off Lantus. Appetite decreased. Developed pain in rib cage. Low blood sugar levels_ fatigue_ dizziness. Decreased to 1.2. Rib cage pain is worse as time goes on_ Shortness of breath when trying to sleep_ loss of sleep_ Dry mouth in the early morning hours while trying to sleep. Blood sugar has come back up to 140-160. Rash has developed_  Thought it may be shingles but not the case_ pain going around sides toward back_ still very tired_ neck pain_ shoulder pain is starting to develop_ and have a strong burning pain across my abdomen and on both sides of it. Feels like my insides are cooking.
Comments: I had just gone into see my doctor on Tuesday. I am going back today and demanding they take me off of this medication before these symptoms get any worse. I would only use this as a last resort . It will help you lose some weight_ but that isn't a good reason to use it. Rapid weight loss can also be a precursor to cancer_ so maybe it's not something to feel that great about. All I know is_ my body is telling me not to use it anymore and that's good enough for me. Good luck. If I find out I have pancreatitis or worse I will let you know.

Side Effects: I also now have a brain tumor...Unknown if it could be related.  The up side is it is not malignant.  a1c was very good though.  Now that I have not taken it for about 3 weeks all the pain and headaches and upset stomach and reflux have gone...

I am an IDDM person. I use humulinRu-500 insulin. I am very_ very insulin resistant. I also can not walk due to arthritis.I need to loose some weight.So far I have lost 11 pounds.Nausea- injected just before eating; solved problem.Throat burn (not really heart burn)- working on this...
Comments: I would welcome help with this. Or any ideas on how to help it work better.

Side Effects: Initially nausea but I found if I gave the injection and then ate breakfast within 10 minutes_ it was much better. Since then just random bouts of nausea when I go too long without eating. At the end of my second week_ I started getting extremely bad diarrhea . It would happen shortly after eating. And usually 2-3 times after a meal. That equals 10 or so bouts a day.
Comments: So far I'm very happy. It's not an easy drug to get started on. But I stuck with it through the first week and it has been very tolerable the second week. My blood sugars have dropped significantly. Back in to the 90-110 range 2 hours after eating. I am on 2_000 mg of metformin and 5mg of glipizide twice a day. But I suspect that as I continue to lose weight and eat better_ those will be able to be eliminated. So far I've lot 10 lbs in two weeks. My appetite is very mild_ bordering on not interested in eating. Without even trying_ I am eating 1/4 of the amount of food I usually eat in a day. And I'm feel full all day long!!!! It took a week to get my energy back. I realized right away that if I'm eating a small amount of food it is more important to eat nutrient-dense food and my energy has rebounded. My only hurdle now is to figure out how to stop diarrhea. I am going to start with greek yogurt in the mornings and some probiotics as people have suggested here. It is tough to get started but I believe I'm past the worst of the bad symptoms and it's been very tolerable this last week.

Side Effects: Mild nausea_ stomach cramping_ heartburn and headache. Severe diarrhea and fatigue
Comments: Symptoms subsided after about 4 weeks. I've lost 11 pounds so far. This is my 1st week symptom free so I'm anxious to see if the weightloss continues. I've been on 1_000mg of Metformin per day for about 2 years and my blood sugar began to get higher & higher. Victoza improved my sugar levels immediately.

Side Effects: DO NOT TAKE THIS DRUG.. IT IS A POISON TO YOUR BODY. It is most possibly the worst drug ever.  Yes I lost weight and my A1C was lower but I had to undergo $100_000 worth of testing after I took this drug. It completely messed up my body and is so not worth it. Being in the hospital because of a drug is not ok. The people who have only been on it for 5-10 days and are commenting should not be able to. Yes_ I too was fine for the first two weeks. Just wait you will feel like death soon and your body will not be able to function.  It is a very harmful drug that should not be allowed on the market.  Please listen to your body!!
Comments: DO NOT TAKE THIS POISON

Side Effects: After four months and moving from 1.2 to 1.8 vomitted and irregular stool pattern--more frequent toilet visits.  I have been fatigued with headaches.
Comments: Lost 30 lbs. in four months and BMI lowered from 39 to 33.

Side Effects: Burping. Fatigue is getting worse. Nausea and abdominal discomfort not bad now.
Comments: Lost 10 lbs in the first 3 weeks with some discomfort and mood swings.  .Fatigue is getting worse. I might have to quit. Doc says exercise and eat better. Hope it works. So far it was worth it just for the 10 lbs

Side Effects: Mild nausea during 1st couple of weeks. Now only occasionaly. Having increased hypoglycemic episodes if no between meal snack.
Comments: Immediaely dropped blood sugars from 140-160 (fasting) to 90-115 (fasting). in2 weeks. Amazing drug.

Side Effects: Nausea and vomitting_ very extreme_ stomach cramps and headaches.
Comments: Originally lost 50 lbs on victoza_ but in the last 4 months have gained 30 lbs back.  No longer affects appetite.

Side Effects: Bad diarrhea when starting to use medication.  Daily stomach cramps and fatigue.  Intense throat / lung cold 3 weeks into treatment (may not be related).  Ended with intense nausea_ vomiting and dry heaves.
Comments: Stopped using Victoza.  Do not use this product.Further research revealed increased cancer risk.  Going to have a stern talk with the prescribing doctor about this.http://www.diabetesmine.com/2011/06/newsflash-fda-issues-warning-on-victoza.htmlhttp://www.youhavealawyer.com/blog/2012/04/20/victoza-recall-lawsuit/

Side Effects: Diagnosed Severe Pancreatitis and he stopped the Victoza injections immediately.   Started out with a lot of burping_ then diarrhea_ nausea vomiting.  Like others_ food would not digest_ just sit in my stomach and rot until I threw up.  Had to get anti-nausea meds so my body could be fed.
Comments: The product worked well and I did lose weight.

Side Effects: Mouth dry and diarrhea..
Nauseus feeling first two days right after taking med_ light headache_very mild stomach cramps first few days
Comments: I LOVE this med so far! I am taking it along with metaforim. I have been diabetic 2 for over 10 years and just the metaforim only was not working lately. The weight loss effect is an added plus! I have lost 9 lbs in 10 days! I started at .6 for a week and then upped it per doctor to 1.2  I have no appetite which is awesome! And I am getting my energy back!

Side Effects: Painful headaches_ nausea_ diarreha_ the medicine does help but the side effects are not worth it. I did the slow intake of the dosages starting at .6 and moving up every two weeks. the headaches grow in pain.
diarhrrea_ stomachache.  weight loss   5 lbs in 1 week. : )

I developed severe stomach pain followed by nausea and then vomiting and diarrhea at the same time.  The rest of the time I would have severe constipation.  The palms of my hands would become very red_ my mouth would get very dry and I could feel the ridges in the top of my mouth. My first episode began on the third day of taking the Victoza_ and I had approx. 1 episode a week until I stopped taking it.
Comments: My first episode required a visit to the ER and another visit  the paramedics were called. That was the first time I had ever been to an ER or had the paramedics called. Subsequent episodes would leave me unable to work the rest of the day.

Side Effects: Nausea_ vomiting_ diarrhea_ muscle aches_ migraine (usually not all at the same time_ thankfully)
Comments: I started at loading dose of .6 for several days_ then went up to 1.2 which was a bad idea because I got very ill with vomiting and diarrhea _ also some muscle cramping in the backs of my legs and even got a terrible migraine. Backed down to .6 and symptoms left. Now I go up a click every few days_ working my way up to my prescribed dose of 1.2. Currently on .9 dosage. I lost 10 pounds initially but have not lost any more weight even though I hardly eat at all_ I'm just not hungry. I feel more energy than I have for a while so I am quite happy with the drug_ but the cost is prohibitive.

Side Effects: severe diarhea and gass for a week_ which my dr says was most likely from the crossover from metrformin to the 1.2 does of victoza. glucose elevels immediately stablized. nausea_ tenderness and slight headache continued for a while longer after diarhea stopped. now everything is okay_ with slight constipation from time to time.
Comments: really works predictably and well_ though the first 2-3 weeks were tough. of course regulating your diet is extremely important_ especially re fiber consumption. i'm so happy not to be taking metformin_ which really didn't work for me_ and also gave me very painful/unpredicatble stomach problems.

Side Effects: Fatigue_ nausea_  severe headaches_unable to do daily work_ cramps_ diarrhea.
Comments: Why on earth would the FDA approve a drug that causes CANCER in rats and mice?  And_ even more puzzling_ why would a physician prescribe a druge that causes CANCER?

Side Effects: Debilitating nausea_ vomiting_ extreme fatigue. I had a Lap Band_ and thought that my symptoms were from that_ so eventually I had the Lap Band removed. In the recovery phase from removing the Lap Band_ the symptoms intensified greatly. Food made me very nauseated_ and I could hardly make it through a day at work.  Then I ran out of the needles for injecting Victoza_ and the next day I was much better.  Got needles_ took Victoza and the following day I was back to feeling rotten.  So I stayed off the Victoza over the weekend_ again felt much better.  Saw MD_ switched to another antidiabetic medication and have had no further symptoms!
Comments: Victoza_ along with Metformin and diet_ exercise_ did help keep my HbA1c lower_ and I was blaming the nausea and often vomiting on the lap band.  I did lose some weight while taking the Victoza_ but at the cost of being completely miserable most of the time.  I wonder if I would have needed to have the lap band removed had I discovered this adverse effect of the Victoza sooner?  I guess I will never know.  I would like to emphasize that for me_ the nausea and fatigue were not just annoying_ they were life altering.  The side effects were often debilitating_ and once I stopped taking the Victoza_ the relief was amazing.  I realize that the company might say that it was the Lap Band causing the side effects_ and that is what I thought_ and why I had it removed.  But the symptoms continued unabated_ in fact worsened as I was recovering from the surgery_ and did not abate until I stopped taking the Victoza.

Side Effects: the first day I experienced irregular heartbeat about 4 hours after the dose. This lasted till 5am the next day. I took magnesium and havent had that problem since. Day 3 I ate my "usual" amount for breakfast_ and later was nauseated_ and later had diarrhea_ but when not eating my habitual amount I am fine. Today day 5 had a snack in the morning of cashews_ and almonds_ and about 45 min. later was shaking from low Blood Sugar. Still taking a low dose of Metaglip (metformin and glipizide) which "kicks" the pancreas to produce all day.  Hope to soon get off the glipizide. So far getting used to not wanting to eat as much. very excited about the results so far. minimal side effects!
Comments: I would recommend to try this drug. for me it has been great so far!

Side Effects: Bad upset stomach from the morning of the 2nd day. On 3rd day seem to be easing up. Blood sugar level was the same on 8mmol/l the 2nd day but dropped to 7.5mmol/l the 3rd day. I guess it is still very early days and got to get over the side effects however hope this will not be a recurring thing as I hate having an upset stomach. I have heard and read great reports from using Victoza including from my doctor and phamacist. Looking forward to the results for reduction in blood glucost level but especially in weight loss. Main aim for weight loss is due to sleep apnea.
First week I felt a lot of fatigue. But after that things are perfect.  I have lost 29 pounds in 6 weeks. No appetite. No sugar cravings. Overall fabulous drug!
Some headaches but can possible be blamed on other causes i.e. allergies_ stress_ etc.  No stomach problems.
Comments: Really helps control my hunger.  Have lost 25 lbs so far.  Love Victoza except for the cost.  OUCH!

Side Effects: Have indigestion but not bad.  When I raised the dosage to 1.2 I started having stomach cramping and diarrhea.  I have called Victoza and they are clueless.  They are of no help.  They claim they have not studied people that have diarrhea and therefore have no info about it.  Victoza is not working alone for me but along with my insulin I do have good sugars but the side effects to me are not worth it.
Comments: Not impressed with the company and no one seems to want to try to talk to you.  They are paying a lot of people for nothing.

Side Effects: Little tummy pains nothing excruciating. However; I'm wondering if Victoza causes problems with your menstrual cycle. I am due for my period amd having all the symptoms of being on my period but i have still not started.
headaches; wicked abdominal pain; N/D; some weight loss; sugars are the best they've been in years.  I need to figure out if the side effects are worth the EXCRUCIATING pain!
Comments: I REALLY hope I can stick with this.  It's the first thing that's worked for me in years.

Side Effects: So far_ no nausea_ no headaches.  A little tummy trouble.  Biggest complaint so far is this HORRIBLE taste in my mouth!  Use mouthwash_ brush teeth_ bad taste always comes back.  Weird...
Comments: So far (only 4 days in) I definately notice a difference in my urge to snack.  Will keep using the med_ but if anyone has any advice on getting the bad taste out_ let me know!

Side Effects: Vomiting_ nausea_ extreme headaches
Comments: Although it is the first drug that has helped me be able to lose weight_ the side effects are awful. I have been taking it 2 months and still manage to vomit at least 3 times a week. On the bright side_ it does work and I have lost 15 lbs. Just rough side effects.

Side Effects: Severe nausea and acid re flux like symptoms first 3 week with severe fatigue.   But well worth the pain now.
Comments: Blood sugar before startin Victoza average 300 to 480 with taking 2 types of insulin 3 time a day. Blood sugar after starting Victoza on 06/09/2011 now averages 70 to 140.  Awesome.   My weight on 06/09/2011 was 325.  Now after Victoza my weight is 246 as of 1201702011.   I have seen concerns from many on here about thyroid cancer that was seen in lab rats .  Please note that the lab rats were given a dosage 10 times greater than the maximum human dose of 1.8.   No tyroid cancer was seen in the ape study _ and non have been reported by humans as of today.   For me the benefits have outweighed the risk !     I will continue Victoza ..   Heaven sent for me.

Side Effects: Loss of appetite
Comments: Finally a drug that helps.  I have reduced my insulin  from 50 of Lantus to 24.  My NovoRapid by 50%  I have lost 10 pounds and my blood sugar iss great and quite predictable.  Makes a great change from chasing highs and lows.  I had been on Byetta for 2 months prior but it did not help at all.

Side Effects: I had only taken 1 dose in the am and later in the evening experienced nausea.
Comments: I am very concerned about the information of victoza that it can cause thyroid tumors and cancer what the insert has said about this medication tested on mice. However_ it said its still unknown about its  effects on human studys_ but clearly states it can cause pancreatic problems in humans. I beleive even though the FDA has approved this drug_ i think its not safe to take this drug yet because of those risks involved. Sorry FDA_ but i have quit taking this drug after i have read this information.

Side Effects: At .6 dosage had slight headache and mild nausea..totally tolerableAt 1.2 dosage have gas_ fould smelling belching_ noisy stomach and rotten breath.  I know this slows down the absorbtion of food in the stomach but I feel like the food is just laying there rottening. I am still having morning lows in the 70s but my bed time numbers have come down to low 100's compared to low 200s.
Comments: I will try to stick this out for a couple more weeks as other posts have mentioned the symptoms lessening and I would love to have some weight loss.  If they don't then I will have to stop this drug.  The foul smell and rumbling stomach is really embarrassing!

Side Effects: Severe stomach pain_ stomach spasms_ nausea_ diarrhea_ headache_ esophageal spasms and slight loss of weight.
Comments: This drug is not worth the pain you have to go through again and again just to lose a few pounds.

Side Effects: Loss of appetite_ Headache_ nausea_ tiredness.
Comments: Works wonders for me. Started June 9th 2011.Lost 49 lbs in 3.5 months.Stopped all insulin injections first week. BG was 340 to 400 with insulin injections before victoza. After Victoza BG is 89 to 120. Heaven sent for me.

Side Effects: to start the usual_ sickness _but now ive found that its causing major heartbeat probs when i try to do anything wich also makes me very breathless
Comments: this has got my sugars well down from 19/ 22 to 7/9 wich for me is brill as i do like my chocky and stuff but very anoyed of this effect that has accured now

Side Effects: None
Comments: Works wonderful!!! Lost 22 pounds so far and have been using it   5 months now.  Would recomend to anyone to give it a try. My A1C went from 9.9 to 7.3 the first 3 months.

Side Effects: Severe nausea; diarrhea; stomach pain.
Comments: I switched to Victoza from Janumet with hopes of achieving better HgA1C control (mine had been running approx 7.0-7.1).  At my first 3 month check up with my MD after the switch to Victoza_ my A1C had risen to 7.7. I asked to stop the med since my quality of life was suffering (ex: constant N/D> immediately having to run to the bathroom after eating a meal). He asked me to continue taking Victoza for another 3 months to see if things improved.  The side effects seemed to improve somewhat; but I would still get occasional nausea and diarrhea_ plus also these occasional sharp shooting pains and discomfort in my upper abdominal region. In addition_ my weight increased by several pound.  At my next 3 month check up_ my A1C had risen even higher to 8.5.  At that time_ I asked my MD if we could stop it and and restart the Janumet. He agreed.   Victoza did not work for me at all.

LOVE THIS DRUG...NO SIDE AFFECTS AT ALL_IT HASWORKED FOR ME BETTER THEN ANY OTHER DIETS/MEDSI HAVE EVER TAKEN...I WAS SCEPTICAL TO USE AT FIRST BECAUSE OF ALL THENEGATIVE COMMENTS_HOWEVER IT HAS BEEN A TREMENDOUS DRUG FOR ME..........THANKS VICTOZA I HAVE LOST 25# IN ONLY 28 DAYSTHE DOCTORS ARE PLEASED AND SO AM I....

Side Effects: Fast heartbeat - tachycardia
Comments: Had to stop this drug and go back to Byetta.  Heart rate was too fast.

Side Effects: First week on .6ml_ dizzy one day_ diarrhea 2 days_ upset stomach 2 days.  None of these affect occured at the same time.  So_ basically I was having some kind of a problem for 5 days in the first week.
Comments: Endo_ put me on Victoza as A1C was 7.3.  He prescribed .6 for 1 week_ 1.2 for 2 weeks then onto 1.8.  I never dialed up to 1.2 as I didn't want to get sick again after the first week.  I gradually dialed an extra click past .6 over a 3 week period to avoid some of the problems.  I did -- I stop with only 5 clicks past .6 --- bacically it's 1/2 between .6 and 1.2 or .9.  This is where I've been.  A1C is now 6.4.  Lost 10 lbs. the first week_ gained back 8. Probably from not eating from being sick. With summer being here I will be more active -- hopefully I'll be able to lose more weight -- this will help to low my A1C. I've been very pleased with Victoza -- except for the cost.  The drug has helpped me to control my diabeties.

Side Effects: Extreme nausea_ diarerhea_ stomach pain_ general aches and pains_ lost 11 pounds in 10 days
Comments: The side effects became more severe as time progressed_ I found myself so sick_ I didn't want to get out of bed_ even slight movement made the nausea worse.

Side Effects: Violent vomiting every 3 days_ constant burping_ gas_ stomach noises_ rash at injection sites_ food staying in stomach and rotting_ bad breath_ loss of appetite
Comments: Side effects diminishing after 1 month_ NO weight loss_ sugars coming down slowly

Side Effects: Fatigue_ malaise_ no loss of appetite_ leg pain_ no reduction in BG levels_ headaches_ nausea.
Comments: Doesn't work for me at all.

Side Effects: Nausea which went away after first 10 days_ maybe fatique not sure if it is mistakes I have made in diet change.
Comments: This medication has changed my life along with a new very strict diet and joining a gym_ which is somethimng i would not have been able to do before starting Victoza I am beginning to feel like the old me again!!!!!!

Side Effects: At first it worked great for reducing appetite and sugars. Very dry mouth_ bad taste_ and nausea. HOWEVER_ developed excruciating upper abdominal pain relieved by leaning forward (definately pancreatitis). Can no longer take the drug and now my pancreas is fried_ as I have lost control over my sugars. A1Cs were always in the 5-6 range before Victoza. Now I have to take TWICE the humalog and Lantus I ever did.
Comments: I am afraid this drug has seriously damaged my pancreas. I do NOT recommend this drug.
WAS JUST INFORMED BY MY WELLNESS NURSE AFTER STUDYING MORE ON THIS MED_ THAT LONG TERM USE CAN CAUSE THYROID CANCER.

Side Effects: Constipation
At first I had headache but those went away with time_ maybe a month. I lost 30 lbs in the first 3 months of taking and my A1C came down 3 points.
Comments: The only complaint I have is the cost! HOLY COW!

Side Effects: Fatigue_ weakness
Comments: Works for weight losss. however I think there has to be a better way. Quality of life is more important

Side Effects: Loss of appetite_ lower sugars_ dry mouth_ bad taste in mouth_ heartburn_ esophageal spasms.
Comments: Pros: Lost 15 lbs and had no appetite at all. Fasting sugars were initially much lower (80ish)_ but returned to more typical range (95+) after several weeks. Cons: Fatigue_ dry mouth_ bad taste in mouth all day. Caused bad heartburn (never had before) and esophageal spasms (ended up in hospital for the chest pain from the spasms). Will stop taking for several weeks for symptoms to clear up and may start again at a lower dose.

Side Effects: Have to manage nausea almost every day.  No vomiting.  Fatigue and much slower athletic performance -- swimming -- about ten seconds slower per hundred.
Comments: My doctor has advised me to skip a day here and there to manage symptoms.  Also to decrease dosage.  I am now trying 1.2.  I have lost about ten pounds.  I am pleased that I have had some weight loss_ so I am willing to suffer to lose more.

Side Effects: Mild nauses and heartburn
Comments: Has helped control my appetite and decrease sugar craving

Side Effects: headache_ naesua_ sore throat
Comments: seems to help with appetite control_ rarely even hungry now! sugars are definately lower than they have been in years.

Side Effects: nausea loss of appetite
Comments: Taken drug for one week by injection_Dr says it will lower my AC1 levels and I will lose weight waiting to see how well it works.

Side Effects: After injection I can taste the medicine in my throat. Had a light headache on the first few weeks but went away.
Comments: Over the past 6 weeks I've lost 15 pounds. I do not have any urge to snack. I have to remind myself to eat. I also don't eat much. Medicine works very well for me.
